name: Hotel Europa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My mum and I have just returned from 6 nights at this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Peaceful with fabulous comfy beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The simple and elegant decor really makes you feel at home - as do Gassim and Miriam, who run the family firm.
reviews.title: 2 star hotel, 4 star service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived they made is feel welcome and helped us with maps, bookings, restaurant choices, etc.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite (room 32) which is a large room with the comfiest bed I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Top everthing!

likes.liked: — hard to decide--but I'll have to go with the personalities of everyone who works there
likes.disliked: — the outside of the building--I was worried when I first saw it, but it in no way reflects the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The shuttered window opens out to a pleasant and peaceful courtyard.
reviews.title: Most comfortable hotel ever stayed at

likes.liked: — The owners/staff, comfort level and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a real find. It is definitely a home from home. The accommodation is good, and the family who run the hotel are extremely attentive. We would recommend it wholeheartedly to anyone who wants an hotel which is very central in Florence at reasonable rates.
reviews.title: Loved the Europa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently completed a two night stay at The Hotel Europa in Florence and, based on our experience, we would strongly recommend this hotel for any and all travelers seeking a comfortable, quiet oasis in the midst of frenetic Florence!
reviews.title: A Great Choice in Florence!

likes.liked: — Location... Price/Value... Friendliness of the Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room on the 2nd floor was (suprisingly) quite large by European standards, very clean and comfortably appointed... and the bathroom was completely updated. Despite the hotel's unique entrance being just off a busy thoroughfare (Cavour), our room faced a quiet courtyard and could not have been more peaceful.
reviews.title: Warm, Friendly, Home Away From Home Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel's location is another strong selling point to consider. All of the key museums and sites in Florence are within an easy 15-20 minute walk of the Hotel Europa.
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The front desk was amazing! They really went above and beyond.
likes.disliked: — The air conditioning could have been better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. And each morning, Gassim made us feel like highly-valued guests, insuring that all of our breakfast requirements were fully met.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Very Nice Owner

likes.disliked: — Not a lot in the immediate vicinity of the hotel

reviews.title: nice hotel with a lovely view
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel with a lovely view, the staff makes you feel welcome. the rooms are spacious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A two-star hotel should be a 3/4 star
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We visited the Hotel Europa for the 2nd time in the last 2 years this Sept. We could hardly wait to go back to this hotel as we had such a wonderful experience 2 years ago. We were not disappointed. This hotel is steps away from the Duomo and a short walk to the Ponte Vecchio and many delicious restaurants. It is a quiet hotel despite being on a main street, as almost all the rooms face toward an inner courtyard. Peaceful and relaxing. The one aspect, however, that sets this hotel apart is the family who own it. Gassim, Mary, Miriam, and Robert are exceptional and for us, the Hotel Europa is the only hotel in Florence that we will stay at.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Vancouver, Canada
reviews.title: Fab Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Europa for three evenings during our trip to Italy. Nader welcomed us and showed us to our well appointed & very clean room. We really enjoyed staying at the hotel, with a great location, tasty breakfest (Nader made me cappuccinos every day) and comfy room. We would both highly recommend this hotel, espeically with the great price. (Contact directly and pay in cash).
reviews.title: Great Location; Friendly Folks!

likes.liked: — Friendly people; air conditioning worked well; comfortable bed; clean
likes.disliked: — Not so convenient to the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only stayed here for one night as we were passing through, but we were happy to find comfortable beds and all the amenities we like. A full bathroom, internet access, and a large breakfast. It included the usual Italian breakfast of pastries, cappuccino, meats and cheeses, but they also had eggs, both hard-boiled and scrambled. Stopping in around 9pm with no reservation we got a great last minute rate of 104 euros for a room with two twin beads. Parking was in a gated lot just 1-2 blocks away. My mother and I had a late night glass of wine that we loved and ended up looking for it all through Italy during the remainder of our trip. It was Canalicchio, 2004, Brunello di Montalcino and was only 7 euros a glass. I can't say much about the area because we came into town after dark and left first thing the next morning to head to Florence.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and accomodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is located very close to station. A place not so attractive, but quiet. A beautiful lobby. Our room TRL was very big size, with a huge convenient bed king-size.Ванная a room very big, unique inconvenience that was not neither curtains, nor screens for a shower. The breakfast was good, only for hotel of 4 stars not so decently to submit an omelette from a powder
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and well located Hotel 3 block from the train station. Good breakfast. The staff was absolutely unhelpful, anytime. We asked for a room change and relunctantly, they did it. I took us some time to convince them we were not happy with the room.
reviews.title: beware of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spend only one night there and we had a nice experience. The hotel has some luxurius touches in its public areas and rooms. The staff speaks English and they are polite and helpful. The room and bathroom are big, clean and very well equipped and the breakfast buffet are rich. They have a parking across the street and its doors opens with your room’s card, but at 15 € a night is a little bit expensive. The hotel is located 10 minutes by foot from Bologna’s center. We had no problem but the area in night seems a little scary.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looks pretty. It was clean and the breakfast was alright, apart from the window-less, miserable room with no atmosphere (like eating in a library!). On the plus side, the hotel is a 5 min walk from the train station. Unfortunately on our first night we were met with prostitutes less than 200 yrds from the hotel entrance. That jaded my whole view of the hotel (did they normally meet men on business there??!)
reviews.title: Lacks atmosphere and service
Friendly in Florence
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Europa on October 10, 2008 and brought friends back for a stay on October 18. The hotel is lovely with clean, spacious, quiet rooms. The newly remodeled rooms are the best choice. The owners, Miriam and Robert, are helpful in every way - our new friends in Florence. Miriam made reservations for us at the Uffizi and Academia. I would definitely return to Hotel Europa.

reviews.title: Great stay and location
reviews.text: We stayed in a large, very clean and quiet room. Miriam and Robert were very friendly and helpful. They made us restaurant reservations, booked tours and museums for us. The breakfast room was cheerful and they were there to welcome you. The only suggestion would be to have a toaster and fresh fruit for breakfast. We found the location excellent within walking distance to most attractions, shopping and restaurants. We enjoyed our stay, felt safe at night and would stay with them again should we come back to Florence.

reviews.title: Great hospitality
reviews.text: Great family run hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. Good locality, only a few minutes walk from the centre. Refurbished to a high standard without loss of character

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great People
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Europa for 5 nights. Our room was lovely with a courtyard view and the Duomo beyond. It was cleaned to a very good standard and had everything required. Miriam and Robert were extremely nice and very helpful with finding good places to go during our stay in Italy. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the price was very reasonable and delighted with the service provided :)

reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during our holiday through Italy and had a wonderful stay at Hotel Europa. The rooms are clean, spacious and well maintained. The staff are incredibly helpful, polite and friendly. And honestly, you couldn't ask for a better location in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I am a return guest to the Hotel Europa as the location and hospitality always keep me coming back. I love the family run hotel. It is very comfortable, clean and newly rennovated. Definitley a favorite!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at Hotel Europa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: A friend recommended this hotel after staying there several times herself, and I was not disappointed. Perfect location – can walk to the most popular spots, very clean, and very nice owners. My room was quite big, though the shower stall small. Breakfast was very simple, but I wanted to save my calories for pasta anyway! Consider a cooking class (outside the hotel) if you’re looking for something to do. “David” is minutes away, and well, well worth it. Zsa Zsa for dinner was fantastic! Free wireless (though slow for me).
reviews.title: Believe the positive reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: really kind people, they gave me a map, and kept my luggage out of check out time!! suggested!!!
reviews.title: calm, in very center,big rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you are in a country that you are unfamiliar with the language, it is a relief to be with people who are so helpful. Mariam and her husband helped us to find an easier way to get train tickets to Venice and from there to Rome and to change hotel accommodations in Venice. We were always welcomed with a warm greeting by the people at the desk, the cleaning staff, and the kind lady who served us breakfast each morning. Clearly the people working here liked their job and the people who visited. The cleanliness and the warmth showed that they all took pride in their work and wanted their guests stay in Florence to be a pleasant experience. Thanks for making our stay in Florence a great memory.
reviews.title: A warm, helpful, family atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only suggestion for improvement would be for fluffier pillows. It was a comfortable, economical room which is what we wanted. The location was great as we could wlak to everything.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great Hotel,short walk from city centre and close to train station. room was very clean and well presented bedding changed evryday along with towels and toiletries,
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Air conditiononing fantastic and not very noisy, Reception and resterant staff very helpful.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

likes.liked: — quality of accommodation and central location

reviews.title: Nice, But Too Far from the Action
reviews.text: Only problem was the Swiss com internet that debit credit card with 49 euros then after you log off charge you the amount used and refund the difference 5 days later.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would reccomend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just returned from visiting Bologna on a last minute trip and it was terrific.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cold (no heating in October), unhelpful, lousy breakfast, though good coffee. We checked out after one night.
reviews.title: Hated it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reviews are spot on. Great location and excellent hosts (Thanks Robert and Miriam). We stayed at Europa for two nights. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Deserves more than a 2-stars rating.
reviews.title: reviews are spot on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I spend two nights at Hotel Europa in September. Our room was very comfortable, clean ,spacious and quiet. The owners couldn't have been more pleasant. Excellent location, within walking distance to the train station. Would return again!
reviews.title: Terrific Accomodations
GREAT HOSPITALITY
reviews.text: we stayed in this fabulous hotel in july and we enjoyed every minute of it ! The entire family is special , the location is excellent, and so is the assistance they give you in finding restaurants, shops (we needed a good wine shop to ship some wine home ), and places of interest, the rooms are beautiful and spotless, the breakfast is delicious .Gassim , Miriam, Robert and Maria ,thanks for the best stay my wife and I have ever had in a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We will be back one day, we hope very soon.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: On our travels through Italy and France, we stayed at the Europa and were a little disappointed to discover our room facing some air conditioning ducting and on the opposite side of the hotel from the sea so where the previous reviewer got the idea that all rooms faced the sea, I have no idea. The hotel does indeed have special touches eg every toiletry you could imagine, good a/c, great sound proofing and champagne to make your own buck's fizz for breakfast. However, in contrast, it lets itself down by being a little shabby in places eg bedroom doors being grubby and bathrooms a little dated, although perfectly clean. Overall the hotel was quite reasonable but biggish and a little impersonal. Rapallo itself is a great place and you can take the boat to several places on the coast for a few euros.
reviews.title: Contrasting hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: We (my wife and I) stayed several nights here. The Staff is excellent. You are just a few steps away from everything in Rapallo. Walk the Streets- it doesn't take that long. All Rooms Overlook the Bay of Rapallo- Food is excellent one of the best in town. Rooms were large and the sunsets were wonderful. The Staff is very helpful. Hotel Standards are very good but please remeber this when comparing to American Standards
reviews.title: Attention Unlimited
great hotel, classical continental style
reviews.text: This hotel has the splendour of the old Italian riviera. Every night a new toothbrush, clean mats in front of your bed etc. A large Jacuzzi on top and friendly staff. European style large rooms with great decorations, soundproofed windows, quiet airconditioners.

reviews.title: American style comfort in the heart of Florence
reviews.text: Lovely, hospitable, comfortable with all the amenities that an American tourist would dream of. In the heart of Florence, on Via Cavour, and about two blocks from the famous Cathedral popularly called the "Duomo", and the bell tower of Giotto. Some of the rooms have great views of the dome and the belltower. It is a well furnished hotel, with amenities such as remodelled bathrooms with showers with towel warmers, hair dryers, and 120V/240V ellectric outlets, individual room heaters and air conditioners, refridgerator hidden in a handpainted desk.

reviews.title: Heartwarming Hospitality !
reviews.text: Close to the central train and bus station, where you catch buses or trains for day trips to Chianti region or elsewhere.

reviews.title: A Wonderful place to Stay
reviews.text: Moderately priced with 5 star ambience. Wonderful service from the family that has owned it for more than 30 years.

reviews.title: Centrally Located
reviews.text: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Florence!

reviews.title: Loved the Europa!
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 5days in Florence where was the last city of our trip in Italy, and stay in Hotel Europe was very pleasant and memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: My partner & I chose this budget hotel for our 4 night stay in Florence. When we first arrived, the taxi stopped in front of a rather depressing store front. We struggled with our luggage in the world’s smallest elevator – we only had one large luggage item each. But things improved with the help of the very friendly staff. The room was also unusually large and very quiet. We had a nice view with large open windows. The location was also quite close to the Duomo.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel - although quite nice
Dante was enchannting
reviews.text: While the hotel was cheaper than other options, it may not have had the qualities of more expensive hotels. However, the staff was very helpful and friendly; the bedroom and bathroom were quite large; the room was very quiet (at one point we thought we were the only ones in the hotel); the windows were huge and opened onto a very pretty and calming backyard; the breakfast was your standard meal; and the hotel was conveniently located to the big sights. As a gay couple, the hotel was comfortable and welcoming. The only slight negative comment is that the bed was hard as a rock.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: If you’re looking for less expensive lodging, this is definitely your best bet – as the service was sincerely helpful and the room was very peaceful (especially after a day of walking through the crowds of tourists).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: Our 5 day stay in the room "Dante" was enchanting. The room with period funiture was beautiful and the bathroom was "modern 2005". The manager/owner (Gassim) lives on the premises and seems to be there 24/7 to serve you breakfast, answer your questions and help with directions, tickets, etc. I must also mention Miriam and her husband as well as David who were the best! Location is within a few steps of everything. This hotel far exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Not as expected, but still a good value
Hotel Europa is wonderful
reviews.text: We were looking for a budget hotel and found an extremely impressive hotel that far exceeded our expectations. It has an exceptional staff, great location and very clean. I highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Europa for 2 nights. Great clean room with a view of the tip of the Duomo. Nice bathroom as well. Easy location to everywhere. Never used public transportation except for bus from train station to hotel. When we left, we were able to walk to the station. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was completely sufficient.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with a beautiful room, helpful staff and great location
Would Definitely Go Back
reviews.text: They are on the second floor so if you have a lot of luggage, take heed. There is an elevator, but it is small. My wife and I each had a large suitcase and two carry bags and had no issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved this place and would stay there again in a second.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I've traveled extensively in Italy but have not spent a good deal of time in Florence. I had the opportunity to spend two nights, during two separate weeks, at the Hotel Europa in Florence. I could not have been more pleased. The location is excellent, the accommodations were immaculate, pleasant, quiet and LARGE for a city, but the real reason to stay here is that it is family owned and operated. Miriam and Robert were accommodating, delightful, helpful and pleasant in each and every way that a traveler could expect. I detected no pretentiousness, no false pleasantries, nothing other than a sincere love and enjoyment for what they do. They helped us in each and every way.....directions to specific restaurants, help with local bus tours for friends, museum reservations. We were thrilled. Absolutely positively, we would stay here again. Kudos to Robert and Miriam. Bonnie Guzman
reviews.title: our home in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Europa in September 2005 and returned with our two teenaged children this year. The location and value of this gem cannot be beat. It is a 5 minute walk to the Duomo, Florence's historic center and the Ponte Vecchio. The Hotel's second floor is currently under renovation but the work did not disrupt our stay in the least. Miriam and Gassim were wonderful, making restaurant reservations and helping us with directions, etc. The rooms we stayed in on the first floor were newly renovated with modern baths, comfortable beds and a partial view of the Duomo. We awoke every morning to the sound of the bells from the square. The hotel has an elevator. Breakfast was adequate and the coffee was great. We would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Europa again. Miriam and Gassim made it feel like home away from home.
reviews.title: Great Great Hotel... Wished Was The Same Everywhere..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this family run hotel for 2 nights. It is located in walking distance of the main train station between the Duomo and Galleria del'Academia so the location is perfect! Although it is situated on a busy road, the rooms are in the back of the building and we heard nothing but birds and church bells. The rooms are charmingly decorated and comfortable. The bed was good too. Perhaps not up to standard if you are used to top-end hotels but perfectly clean and pleasant. The best part of the hotel however (apart from the location) are the people that work there. They are very friendly and helpful and make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotels to friends and family.
reviews.title: LIke staying in someone's home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on the reviews at Tripadvisor. As the reviews all say this is a great little hotel in the heart of Florence. You can walk to everything, including the Train station. The rooms are large, especially the family rooms which are actually huge. We easily fit 4 kids into the room. Our only complaint was the breakfast could have slightly better. Also they were renovating the 3rd floor, which added some noise, but I would expect them to be finished soon. Maybe you should ask if you book.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, lovely hosts

likes.liked: — The sweet owners who treated us like family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel recommended a good restaurant (ZaZa) that is only a few blocks away it was our favorite in Florence. Also make sure you make it to the outside market just around the corner (closed Mondays) from the hotel. My wife bought a beautiful leather jacket for 60 Euros. We saw similar one in NYC last week for over $600. Make sure to bargain. The price quoted started at $150 Euros.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a lovely stay! The hotel is in a terrific location and has beautiful Florentine rooms that are kept very clean. The owners are wonderful, and despite a few small problems, they resolved all our concerns and gave us wonderful service. Miriam made reservations for us at the museums, which saved us hours of waiting in line. She also recommended an amazing restaurant, which turned out to be THE BEST food we had in our entire trip to Italy. The price was reasonable considering the great location (right between the Duomo and the Accademia) and the personalized service. I'd definitely go back the next time I'm in Florence.
reviews.title: Family run hotel, warm and friendly service
Fantastic stay in every way
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights; it is fantastic. It is family operated and they treat their guests like family. The room was clean and recently renovated, but most importantly, it was quiet although it is situated only minutes from the Duomo and David. Breakfast is fine, nothing fancy. Wonderful location for sightseeing and the bus/train terminal. They gave discount for payment in cash. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Great Location for Sightseeing
reviews.text: This hotel has a perfect location for walking to all the important sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very large, quiet room with high ceilings (#37). The bathroom was unusually large, too.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Reviews... Seriously

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was o.k., but the quality of the baked goods was not as good as we had elsewhere. Also, breakfast was served in a make-shift breakfast room because the reception area and breakfast room were being remodeled. The food may taste better in the more attractive surroundings.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful family-run hotel

likes.disliked: — Construction made it slightly dusty but not a huge problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just returned from my second stay at Hotel Europa (4-day stay August 4-7th, 2007 and August 2005). Once again, I am extremely happy with this hotel that I felt I had to write a review to share the news. With all confidence I can say that when you visit Florence, this is the place you must stay!!! Here's why:
reviews.title: Hotel Europa: A real treasure in Florence!!
Our Home in Florence
reviews.text: 1) Location: To your left, Il Duomo. To your right, the Galleria dell'Accademia (where Michelangelo's David is located). Across and down the street, Florence's famous outdoor market. 10 minute walk, the train station. A better location would be impossible to find!! And although everything is in close promixity, the street where Hotel Europa is located is quiet and quaint at night. A perfect 10!

reviews.title: Our Favorite Spot and Favorite People!
reviews.text: 2) Facilites: Clean, spacious, & modern amenities located in a small hotel atmosphere! The Standard room that we stayed in was just perfect. Great size, air-conditioned, large washroom with shower, fridge, TV, great views of the courtyard and Il Duomo. And...the price is right! Affordable rates for superior quality!

reviews.title: Five Star Service
reviews.text: 3) The Staff: To me, this is the final seal on why you should stay at Hotel Europa. I cannot tell you how kind, helpful, generous and warm Gassim & Maria are! (I have not met Miriam but I am sure she is just as wonderful!). A family-run establishment where you are treated with individual attention and care rather than just your typical revolving-door hotel. These people make you feel like you're at home in Italy; their home. By far the nicest people I've met in Italy (and I've travelled the "boot" from head to toe!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There you have it, short & sweet.
reviews.title: An affordable gem!

likes.liked: — Comfortable, quiet, air conditioned, clean room with great view and location
likes.disliked: — Coffin size lift up to hotel, but it was great they had one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, very helpful with parking the car nearby and the manager / owner is very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the older floor , so the furnishings were not so good , but it was cheaper than most other nearby hotels and over all is perfectly good for a short stay.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff

likes.liked: — Location and friendly check in / staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of five (2 adults and 3 children 15, 13,11) stayed for 2 nights in October and loved it! While my husband parked our rental car, I ran ahead up the stairs to book in and was greeted by the lovely, smiling face of Gassim who quickly went to the fridge and handed me an icy bottle of water. My husband brought our daughter in a wheelchair plus our luggage up and was very warmly greeted by Gassim who offered us help in getting us into our gorgeous suite. It was two huuuuge rooms plus a bathroom, so cool and relaxing and not to mention spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Friendliest experience in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: While we were marvelling at the space and settling in, there was a knock at our door and there was Gassim with a tray of iced juice for all of us! I can honestly say, in our week in Italy, he was the kindest, friendliest person we came into contact with.
reviews.title: The Staff are outstanding!

likes.liked: — The size of the suites, location, staff support
likes.disliked: — small elevator although it is typical of older european hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our children loved it so much they wanted to cancel our 2 nights planned in Sorrento and stay on in Florence!
reviews.title: loved the staff and location.
A Good Choice
reviews.text: The hotel is, indeed in a very ordinary, nondescript building on the 1st and 2nd floor so if you aren't prewarned you could really miss it. Luckily I had read all my Tripadvisor info so was armed with good, useful information!.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Europa for 4 nights while on vacation in Italy. Upon arrival, we were pretty tired from the walk from the train station to the hotel lugging our bags and Gassim greeted us with a large very cold bottle of water which we really needed. We stayed in the Rafaello room, number 35 and the hotel was well kept and the room was large and clean. Our room overlooked a courtyard and we could see the very top of the Duomo from our 2 windows. I am a very light sleeper and even though we were in the middle of the city, the room was SO quiet. The location is only 1 block from the Duomo and everything is within walking distance, no subway or taxi needed. We rented a car for 2 days and Gassim helped us by calling someone to pick up the car and parking it for us overnight.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Gassim works tirelessly and is extremely helpful. He is always available for directions or restaurant recommendations. Miriam is also very helpful. She made our museum reservations prior to arrival which allowed us to bypass all lines at the Accademia and Uffizi. It is also very nice to have the free Internet service which enabled us to talk to our families over e-mail after being gone for a week.
reviews.title: Great Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated my birthday and our wedding anniversary in Florence and the day of our anniversary, Miriam and Gassim gave us a delicious celebratory bottle of Chianti. We thought this was very generous of them.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Great value for money with a smile
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Europa and will recommend this property to anyone else we know who is visiting Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Hotel Europa! The staff was super friendly helping us with everything we requested. The hotel was perfectly situated so that we could walk to everything. The room was very clean and the breakfasts were delicious! You get a whole lot for your money here!
reviews.title: Best Value Hotel in Europe I have Encountered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I picked this hotel based on good reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the location was excellent - about 10-15 mins walk from the train station and close to all major sites. Duomo/Academia were only 5 mins away, Uffizi 10 mins. Plenty of amenities around: cafes, restaurants, laundromat, supermarket, etc. While the hotel is on a main street, our room (called 'Michelangelo') was facing a courtyard and was very quite.
reviews.title: A Perfect Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the room was spacious and clean. Nice to have a tiled floor for a change! We liked the florentine furniture, very elegant.
reviews.title: Well-located Hotel Europa

likes.liked: — Close to all the major attractions, lovely staff
likes.disliked: — Rooms were boring, bathroom small, mosquito problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thirdly, the guy who welcomed us to the hotel was excellent, a gentleman - forever polite and could not do enough for the guests. We arrived early in the morning(i.e. before check-in time), he let us deposit our bags and made us two cappaccinos before we set off signtseeing.
reviews.title: Great find

likes.liked: — Convenience, lovely attitude and competence of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 1st trio to Florence. We had an amazing time in such a beautiful city. When we arrived we were shown to our room by Miriam, who returned shortly afterwards with a cool drink of juice and a map, she explained all the best places to go. ALl of the staff at the Europa are friendly and will help you in anyway that they can. Miriam told us about Za Za's restaurent and it was the best one that we visited, entirely reasonable with amazing food. Would recommend the wine tasting tour through walking tours as it was great and you get to see so much. Our hotel room had a fantastic view of the Duomo as we had opted to pay more for a room with a balcony, lovely to sit out at with a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing. Hotel was clean and well kept. Breakfast was fairly basic, ham, cheese, bread, crossiants and cereal but the coffee was fab. Would definalty go back to Florence and pay another visit to the hotel Europa!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Europa for 3 nights in May. We had a suite room which had two large windows that gave us a nice quiet view. We could even see the very top of the Duomo Dome and Giotto's Bell Tower. The room was large with a high ceiling. It was very nicely decorated and clean. We are still amazed at the window treatment : shutters+glass panels + wooden clapboards + sheers + curtains. Wow! We were impressed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast included hard-boiled eggs, cold cuts and cheese, croissant, Kellogg's corn flakes and cocoa krispies, juice, fruit, yogurt, rolls and toast. Gassim was a gracious host and made a wonderful cup of cappuccino.
reviews.title: Wonderful comfortable hotel

likes.liked: — Being able to walk to all the sights and shopping
likes.disliked: — I liked everything, but someone who is a 5 star type person, might want something more fancy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was a computer with Internet access in the lobby which allowed us to get in touch with our family. The location is very convenient - about a 5 minute walk to the Accademia, the Duomo and the Medici Chapels and 15 minute walk to the Uffizi. Getting to the SMN train station was easy too- we just took the bus (#1, #7 or #17) at the stop right across the street.
reviews.title: miriam is a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we were very happy with this hotel
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - made our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: We arrived to Hotel Europe after having been up over 24 hours traveling to Italy from California. There was a small glitch in our reservation in that we had booked 2 rooms, somehow we ended up with 3. And the hotel was having some plumbing problems that day. Miriam fixed the problems, which was quite hard to do with us because we were semi-incoherent from being so tired and worn out from traveling.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Europa in Florence was a good option we had picked for ourselves for our 2 day stay at Florence. Very clean beds, toilets(recently renovated hotel), friendly English speaking staff, decent breakfast spread. Located quite close to the Academia and not far away from the Church and Uffizi. The rail station is a few bus stops away, but easily approachable. Reasonable priced, and we got ourselves a good deal. The Turkish restaurant opposite the hotel is a blessing for travellers from the Orient as they serve curry and rice.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Pleasant Stay
Great value, great location - Adam & Bridgette
reviews.text: A very welcoming and efficiently run family hotel. The location is superb wih easy access to the Duomo, museums, markets and the railway station. The rooms are spacious and tastefully appointed to a high standard for a 2 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The owners are always on hand to help with restaurant recommendations, booking tickets e.t.c., nothing was too much trouble. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.
reviews.title: Nice and Close to The Duomo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Easily one of the best value hotels we have stayed in - highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent location and great staff - highly recommended

likes.disliked: — i would not recommend it for people with reduced mobility. the lift is small and the stairs are quite long.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a nice experience at this hotel. The family running it was super friendly.
reviews.title: I wish there was a Hotel Europa everywhere...

likes.liked: — Beautiful, big room, friendly faces of Miriam and Gassim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When you first enter the hotel it throws you because you enter a corridor and have to take the steps or an elevator to the lobby. Once inside the rooms are very spacious, The furnishings and the bathrooms were good, although the beds and pillows were super hard.
reviews.title: Excellent 2 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Hotel Europa in February and had a fantastic time. The location of the hotel couldn't be more perfect and the service provided by the staff there is the best I have ever experienced. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florence.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: When my family arrived in Florence in December 2006, we wanted to find a reasonably priced hotel, close to the centre of the city.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, efficient, reasonable rates

likes.disliked: — We had to leave after only two weeks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could walk to the Hotel Europa from the Florence train station.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Loved the location of Hotel Europa!
reviews.text: Hotel Europe met all our requirements - and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could walk to see the Duomo, the Medici Palaces, the Ponte Vecchio, the Statue of David etc, etc.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Europa
Hotel Europa should be your choice too!!
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Europa for 8 days during our recent trip to Florence (Oct 2005) and it turned out to be an excellent choice of accomodation for us. The hotel is famed for its beautiful Florentine styled suites and we were offered an amazing suite at an even more amazing price! Each suite is individually named with it's own colour scheme. Ours had a deep rich red colour theme. The sheer size is unbelievable! The room door opens into a huge living area with a few large, comfortable sofa chairs (that we later pushed together to create a sofa bed for lounging), a side table (which we later used for our late night cozy suppers), a TV set and lots and lots of space. The bedroom is separate and also very big. It has it's own TV set too. Everything was clean and very comfortable. There were beautiful ceiling frescos both in the living and bedroom. The rooms had triple windows so there was no noise disturbance at all. The bathroom comes with a shower box which surprisingly was like a mini spa with sauna facilities and also numerous water jets that could be activated for a spa-like bath massage.

reviews.title: Great service
reviews.text: Apart from the room itself, the winning aspect of Hotel Europa has got to be it's owners. Gassim, his daughter Miriam and David are all very helpful and made our stay extremely welcoming. From the moment we stepped in and were showed to our room, the service never stopped. Both Gassim and Miriam gave excellent restaurant recommendations (you must try "El Gatto & La Volpe"- in my opinion the best italian pasta and pizza we had in Florence, just ask them where to find it), helped us to make museum reservations, car garage reservations, directions etc. The one thing that stood out and is truly worth mentioning is when we found extra pillows placed in our room without us even requesting for it. We had brought the sofa chair pillows into the bedroom to lean on while we watched TV and left it there the next morning. When we came back that night, we found extra pillows placed in the bedroom for us. We didn't even have to ask, our needs was silently met and we were truly thankful and appreciative of that!

reviews.title: Ya gotta love it!
reviews.text: Breakfast each morning is from 7:30-9:30a.m and the spread very good with ham, salami, cheese, croissants, toast bread slices, cereal, boiled eggs, excellent cappuccino and more. They have an elevator and also provide free internet usage which was a big plus for us. The price of the suites are very affordable. Contact the hotel directly and they will quote you their best rates. The location totally convenient in proximity to many of the main attractions in Florence. I can't think of any drawbacks to choosing this hotel. We had a wonderful stay and confidently recommend Hotel Europa to anyone who wants a home away from home.

reviews.title: magnificent suites
reviews.text: We recently spent nearly a week in Florence, Italy, and stayed at the Hotel Europa. We were very happy with the location (two blocks from the Duomo), and the service was excellent. Gassim, Miriam, and David were more than willing to answer any questions we had, and Miriam went out of her way to arrange for a driver to take us for a nine-hour trip into the Tuscan countryside. We felt like family! Our room was on the first floor and was clean and comfortable, with typical Florentine-style furniture, and looked out onto a lovely courtyard with a view to the Duomo. The bathroom was spotless, with all modern conveniences. We will not hesitate to recommend Hotel Europa to anyone heading to Florence.

reviews.title: I would highly recommend - We loved our stay
reviews.text: Not expecting something this great in a hotel is always a pleasure when you arrive and are greeted by lovely staff who take you to a fantastic room overlooking the main street Yes the windows are double glazed so there is no noise. The staff were fantastic and the location is the best. Make sure you ask for an upgrade when you book direct with the hotel Have safe travels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We can highly recommend Hotel Europa, Via Cavour 14, Florence. We spent 3 nights at this hotel at the beginning of our trip. We had a “suite” which looked out on a quiet courtyard and the Duomo for 150euros. The room was spacious and attractive with a large comfortable bed and was equipped with an air conditioner, TV, and a safe. Friends also had an equally large and appealing room. The bathrooms were clean and more than adequate and were equipped with a hair dryer. At the end of our trip we again stayed at the Hotel Europa for an additional night. This time our room was a little smaller but very comfortable and quiet (it was also 10euros less). We did not see the regular rooms as we had decided from reading Trip Advisor before booking that the “suites” might be worth the extra expense. We were all delighted with the hotel. It is family run. Gassim and his daughter, Miriam, and the family were very warm and helpful which made the stay so pleasant. They are also fluent in English. We were happy to return there for the final night of our trip. The location is excellent. The hotel is only one and a half blocks to the Duomo. This central location made it possible to walk to all the main sites. Don’t be fooled by the entrance to the building. There is a small elevator which will take you up two floors to the lobby of the hotel. The suites are just up one flight so we used the stairs once our luggage was up. Breakfast is included and consists of cereals, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, and croissants. Especially good is the large coffee machine which makes everything: expresso, latte, capuchino, americano etc.. We booked directly with the hotel via email. Communication was easy and replies were prompt. When we return to Florence we will definitely stay again at the Europa. A great find!
reviews.title: Felt at home

likes.liked: — Warm, friendly atmosphere, location, and charming room

reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely position.
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, great position. Although close to the Duomo, the bells were not a problem during the night as they don't start until 7:00am. Our hosts were superb and couldn't do enought to help. Lovely room, large and very quiet. Coffee was excellent, breakfast was okay.

reviews.title: Location was great and Hospitality was Phenomenal!
reviews.text: Would reccommend this hotel for 3/4 nights in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Florence in September, and this was our first stop in Italy so we were quite jet lagged upon arrival. We received a terrific recommendation for dinner, and were given a very quiet room. Florence is a busy town and the hotel is located in a busy area with traffic. However, once you step into the hotel you no longer hear the traffic. That is amazing. So we had a solidly quiet and relaxing haven to return to. And our room was immune to the traffic noise.
reviews.title: Warm welcome in the heart of Firenze!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hospitality is amazing. Miriam, Anton, Miriam's father and mother made all the difference in us enjoying Florence. Such outstanding and warm hospitality; our every question was answered (with patience I might add!) and every need/request met. ). Our stay with Miriam and family is what made Florence even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Hotel Europa is a Gem

likes.liked: — freindly, spacious, clean, good location, reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 14 nights. No complaints about hotel. Room clean, spacious and quiet. Good bathroom with large shower. TV took a bit of working out to get digital channels. Staff friendly and helpful . Good selection at breakfast and everything fresh, dining room bright and spacious. Close to railway station with frequent, cheap services to range of places (we went to Modena, Parma, Ferrara and Marzabotto). Also handy for buses within town. Be prepared to do lots of walking, although some restaurants close to hotel. It helps if you speak some Italian.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (me, my wife and our two kids) stayed at the Europa for one night during our trip back home from the Alps. We thought a good idea to stop and rest and take the chance to see Bologna for the first time (btw, don't you ever go and see Bologna in August...).
reviews.title: Better for business, but consider it, should you find a good deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location excellent if you come by train (5 minutes walking from the Stazione Centrale) or by car (easy to reach coming from the freeways). Not to far from the city center - but not too near if you plan to go walking...
reviews.title: Quite impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is mainly organized for business meetings but we really got a deal and I have to say it was comfortable for one night. Excellent air conditioning. Our room a bit noisy on the night (no traffic in August, it was probably an air conditioning engine near our room). Quite good American breakfast.
reviews.title: A switcheroo with a happy twist

likes.disliked: — It was just a tad off the main streets of Bologna

reviews.title: Close to train station, not to town
reviews.text: In general, try and think of an Italian urban four stars which is just that, a four stars, not more, not less.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Europa made our trip to Florence special. Miriam and her father run the hotel and couldn't have made us feel more welcome. The building is 400 years old and you can really enjoy the charm of the hotel itself. Close to major attractions and walking distance to the train terminal about 15 minutes away. Miriam was more than willing to help us in any way she could and we started our correspondence a few months before we even arrived. The rooms are spacious and clean. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, wish I were there now.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed this hotel 4 nites. The location is excellent. In the heart of city and you can go anywhere within 10 mins.
reviews.title: Excellent location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and helpful staff, making us just feel like at home.
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The room is clean and large. We are highly recommended this hotel when u stay in Florence.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

likes.disliked: — Main Entrance to Elevator, - dark and dreary and scary at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: After numerous recommendations from a friend that stays at the Europa annually, my wife and I joined Capt. Frank for 3 nights while touring Florence. The location is outstanding and most everything is within walking distance. The 13th century building, complete with it's original murals painted on the ceiling are a much added bonus. With out a doubt this was the most accommodating staff we encountered during our 2 weeks in Italy. Our room was huge and very clean. Miriam, and her family catered to our every need and welcomed us into their home as if we were family. We will return!
reviews.title: Warm, Inviting, Close to Everything!

likes.liked: — The view of the Duomo...and, above all else, the level of personalized service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for my Birthday. I have to tell you we love this place and highly recommend it. It is walking distance from the train station. We did a day trip to Venice from there. We loved the shopping close by. The people at this hotel treat you like family. The breakfast in the morning is nice and they have free internet access. The rooms are WONDERFUL. We have no complaints. They even wished me a happy birthday that's how much they pay attention to their guests. It's family owned and run - they are a very nice family and give you great advice and tips. I can't wait to go back someday! We highly recommend it - you won't be dissapointed. Yesenia
reviews.title: I loved this place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Hotel Europe for our 3 nights stay in Florence base on the positive ratings from other reviews here. However, we were pretty disappointed with the hotel room and their services. First, I think it's a two different worlds if you get a suite room on the 2nd floor rather than a regular single/double room on the 3rd. Apparently, we had a double room. The furnishings were pretty old as well as the carpet that we could see the black stains everywhere. The bathroom was so tiny and not equiped well at all. The shower floor wasn't raised up to keep the water in the shower. Afterall, the most upset experience we encountered is the last day in the morning before we check-out. We told the staff we need to go out for some last minutes shopping for about 45 minutes and will come back before 11am which is the check-out time. So, we only left the AC on when leaving the room. Later we came back about 15 minutes before 11, we found out they came to our room and took the batteries out of the TV remote. Also they turned off the AC and removed the AC remote from our room too. This behavior is so rude. we felt that we were being very unwelcomed. I understand it's a family run business but they still need to maintain certain professional services.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of four (including 2 teenage girls) stayed at Hotel Europa from July 29-Aug. 2, 2006. We booked a quad suite (got the Leonardo suite). The hotel was very roomy - plenty of space for our family. The bathroom was very modern. I was a little disappointed at first, as I thought I was getting a suite with a view of the duomo. While we got a very comfortable room, it did not have the view I was expecting. Nonetheless, we still had a wonderful stay. The proprietor, Gassim, was very helpful and polite. He helped us find a nice restaurant (Trattoria Za-Za) that had good food at reasonable prices. Both Gassim and Miriam were prompt in responding to my requests for assistance with booking tours, etc. While we did not have the pleasure of meeting Miriam, I am sure she is just as welcoming as Gassim was.
reviews.title: Reasonable accommodations for a family of four

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were also impressed with the energy conservation feature that they have - your room key has to be in a slot to get the lights and A/C to work. While it would have been more comfortable to return to an air conditioned room from being outside, I certainly appreciated their efforts to conserve energy - something we could all do more of.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff
Great Value!
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: After spending 3 harrowing days in Rome, we arrived at our hotel in Florence. Miriam's warm smile and gracious nature was a welcome relief. She quickely ushered us to our room, which was large by European standards. The room had nice windows with a good view, was impeccably clean, and incredibly comfortable beds! The shower was great, a nice very huge stand-up! Good location as we were within a 10 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio yet the hotel was in a quiet area. There was no street noise at night. Throughout our stay both Gassim and Miriam were wonderful. They provided us with all the info we needed, helped us with making reservations at museums, assisted us with bus and train tickets, and gave recommendations to great restaurants. I can't say enough about how great Gassim and Miriam were. This is a rare gem of a hotel, a family run business, and you can tell they take pride in giving good service and making sure that your stay in Florence is memorable and stress-free. Plus the price can't be beat, although they could charge double and it would still be worth it. We will definitely stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Mason Family
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, 17 year old son and I chose to stay in the Hotel Europa for six days in March after hearing my sister rave about how much she loved the hotel when she stayed here last October. She did not exaggerate what a great hotel this is.
reviews.title: Very nice Staff

likes.disliked: — The weird use of the elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel to be spotlessly clean, very comfortable with large spacious rooms. and ideally located right in the center of things, but away from the noise. We had a suite with painted ceilings that were incredible, rooms that were just huge and a terrific multi jet shower. The best feature though is Miriam and her father. They are both gracious hosts who make you feel welcome immediately. We received great advice on where to dine and reservations were happily made for us (definitely try Zaza's and Il Latino). When we unexpectedly extended our stay, Miriam managed to work out a way to accomodate us. And, when we had time to kill before our flight took off, we were welcomed into the lounge room where we were able to comfortably relax, use the computer and await our departure time in a friendly, homey environment.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience
Perfect Start to Italy
reviews.text: This hotel reflects the standards of days gone by with excellent service, large rooms, great breakfast , the ability to converse in multiple languages and genuine concern and interest in the guests. I cannot say enough about this hotel. There is no doubt that when we return to Florence, we will stay here with our new friends, Miriam and Gassim. Thank you both for making our stay so wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I choose that incredible and warm 2 stars hotel due to its location in the city centre, opposite the Medici Palace and just a few minutes walking to the cathedral. I travelled alone but my room, on the 1st floor, was very spacious, very clean and confortable and from there could see the top of the cathedral. The only inconvenience is that the hotel has not lift, but they help you with your baggage in order to offer the best service as possible.
reviews.title: Excelent quality & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The furniture is absolutely adorable with and ancient regional style, and the small breakfast room is quiet and very luminous. The offer room with buffet breakfast included for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tried to speak in Italian because of my mothertongue is Spanish and they were very patients with me! I assure that they can speak in Italian, English, and a bit of Spanish (and maybe more languages).
reviews.title: If you go to Florence, go to Hotel Europa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure I will come back again.
reviews.title: Great Location, hope to go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was just delighted with the HotelEuropa. I felt as if I had discovered a hidden treasure in the middle of Florence. I could walk anywhere, the staff was friendly and the service was just great. Along with all the usual amenities, the friendly and helpful family that owned the hotel made it feel like a home away from home. That was particular important to me since I was a solo travel.
reviews.title: Perfect mid range hotel
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: A truly wonderful experience. This family owned hotel is in the heart of Florence, close to everything but when I walked through their doors I felt at home. There's no noise of the city and I had a great patio and view of the Duomo. Miriam and her family made me feel at home from the start. They made reservations for me, recommendations and took care of me while in their hotel. I would never consider staying anywhere else in Florence so long as there's a room at the Europa.

reviews.title: Great location, great hosts
reviews.text: Hotel Europa is so close to everything - walking distance to the Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio, Accademia and other attractions. Robert and Miriam were so helpful in making reservations for us including finding us a driver to take us to the wine country. They are lovely and gracious hosts! The rooms are large and comfortable.

reviews.title: A little piece of Old Florence
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Europa Hotel for 11 days in early October. We chose the hotel based on location, size and Trip Adviser reviews, which were very accurate. The location simply cannot be beat - one can walk everywhere. We wanted a small hotel which would provide somewhat the feel of "living in Florence". Europa made that possible. Our room, the Dante, had the feel of old Tuscany and was large, airy and light (two large windows) and super clean. Loved the church bells.

reviews.title: Yes
reviews.text: Miriam and Robert, the managers (Miriam's father owns the hotel), did everything possible to make us feel like family - not strangers while never being intrusive. We had e-mailed the hotel to make reservations and their response was immediate and informative. They also made reservations for us at the Accademia, Uffizi (which they canceled and re-made when we were not feeling well) and the Brancacci Chapel and when we arrived they greeted us like old friends.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: This was my third trip to Florence and I had a long list of places I wanted to visit and spend time. Shortly after our arrival, my husband and I picked up some kind of intestinal virus and Miriam was wonderful! Made hot tea for us while she contacted an English doctor nearby who saw us immediately and prescribed medication that allowed us to do all that we wanted to without any "sick days". She and her husband Robert also saw to it that our every comfort need was immediately met. Our daughter and her husband joined us there after our first week, and when they arrived Miriam seemed as glad to see them as we were and brought us all fresh fruit juice. When we left, she gave us all wine and Biscotti! Delicious!

reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location close to the sea. Poor breakfast.
reviews.text: Cleaning service is ok. Comfortable rooms. Nice bathroom. Please be aware that access to hotel indoor swimming pool and fitness center is not included in the price of your room, although we speak about a 4 stars hotel. Food is few and if you arrive later in the morning it is possible to not get enough food or the same dishes you can find early in the morning (at 08:00 am for example). Nice parking and outdoor swimming pool. Good road access from Constanta and close to Bulgarian sea side if you are interested to visit the neighbor country. All rooms have sea view but only rooms from 1st floor have a larger balcony. If you want to use more than one charger than bring with you an extra plug switcher because the room has only one plug.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights. The owners were really nice and could not be more helpful. The location is fantastic. You can drop your car off for about 20euros/day and walk to anywhere in the city in minutes. The hotel was undergoing some renovation when we were there. This did not disturb us. There was no noise or anything like that just decorating stuff in the corridors. Our room was very clean and practically brand new. They have free online service and an very nice break fast. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a reasonably price hotel in the center of Florence
reviews.title: Helpful owners and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the lovely Hotel Europa for two nights in late April 2007. The charming family owners made us feel so welcomed and they gave us great suggestions for restaurants in the area (Za Za's!). Our room was very large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also very large compared to most we had in other European hotels and it had been newly renovated. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Florence!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel Europa!

likes.liked: — Location, charming family owners, beautiful 13th century building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Europa Firenze in Florence for 2 nights as part of our Italy honeymoon. Prior to actually visiting Florence all of my emails to the hotel were answered promptly and professionally. The staff helped me book reservations for the Accademia and the Uffizzi Gallery. When we arrived at the hotel I initially was a bit concerned going in the front door from the street as it is a dark, not very nicely decorated lobby in a very old building. You have to take a very small "lift" (only holds 1 person and maybe 2 small suitcases) up to the 2nd floor for the actual hotel reception area. However, once we got to the hotel reception area we were greeted by a very nice gentleman who proceeded to check us in, help us get our luggage to our room, and then show us how to work the lights and air in our room. We found out that the hotel is run by his family-they are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel reportedly just went through renovations. Our room was very clean and it looked like most everything in it was new. It was very simple though with no artwork on the walls....they may be still in the process of adding these. The bathroom also looked newer and was very clean. The bed was VERY firm and so were the pillows....a little too firm for me. They served a simple breakfast in the morning of pastries, meats and cheeses, cereal, fruit, and coffee and bread. They also offered free internet access which was nice. The hotel is in a great location in the center of town only 5 minutes to the Accademia, 5-10 minutes to the Duomo, and a 15 minute walk to the Uffizzi. Even though it was in the center of town our room (50) faced the garden area and was extremely quiet. The air conditioning was very nice too as it was in the high 90's while we were there . Overall I thought this was a good place to stay and I would stay there again if back in Florence.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights, lovely people, you feel like you're in their home. Your best bet in Florence is walking, and the Europa is close to everything. It's inexpensive, yet clean and not fancy, but beautiful.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, charming!
Good place in a great location
reviews.text: But above all, these people stepped up to the plate when I lost my passport and had to wait a day to go to the Embassy to get a copy. I felt cared for and protected in what could have been a very difficult experience. They made all the difference. These are good people, as well as running a fantastic pensione. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. As someone else said, I wish I were there now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: We didn't actually stay at Hotel Europa, we had made reservations for a suite and when we arrived apparently there were none remaining. While the gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, the room we got instead was not in any way acceptable, more like a dorm room than a hotel. The "shower" was only 2 folding doors that connected and no basin, water just onto the floor, and if the shower doors were closed you could not use the toilet. The furniture was old, looked cheap, and the hotel did not feel clean. We stayed there only long enough to find anther hotel.
reviews.title: Not as represented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: The location was convenient, and they did offer guests internet access.
reviews.title: Hotel Europa was Charming!
Fantastic location
reviews.text: I stayed in a suite (32?) - was a lovely room with very nice furnishings. Windows opened up onto a square - was very quiet. Was nice and sunny in my room - very pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: Bed was a queen size, extremely comfortable. Bathroom was a good size. Room was very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: Overall, the service was great. Owners were very accomodating. I felt very much at home.
reviews.title: Best service in Italy
Loved the Hotel Europa!
reviews.text: The Hotel Europa in Florence was outstanding! The rooms were larger than most in Europe. They were clean, neat, and attractive. I think the location was excellent. The most outstanding part of the hotel though was Mr. Gassim and his family who manage the hotel. They were so friendly, pleasant and accomodating! We enjoyed breakfast upstairs each day and enjoyed talking with them. When we go to Florence again, we will surely stay here!

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: The Hotel location is excellent. Just a couple of blocks from the Duomo. The staff was very helpful. Miriam even went so far as to sell our reserved tickets to the Museum Accadamia when I got the dates wrong. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a great location. It feels more like a family run bed and breakfast than a hotel. Room was very clean and modern – better than the star rating suggests. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Renovations didn’t interrupt our stay and should be finished shortly.
reviews.title: Best Value Hotel in Florence
Wonderful - perfect hospitality!
reviews.text: You could not ask for nicer hosts or a better location. Close to everything. The rooms are fine, nothing extravagant but nice and clean and very roomy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this place are your hosts. Their website says "Miriam, Robert, Gassim, Mary and all the staff are ready to host their guests with individual attention and care..." and that's exactly what you can expect.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay.
Excellent service, great value for your money
reviews.text: I can't say enough about how wonderful everyone was during our visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to Florence.
reviews.title: Supreme Service, Wonderful Location

likes.disliked: — Front entry is not terribly inviting. An inexperienced tourist might not think it is as nice a place as it is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother, aunt and cousin for 2 nights. We had room #121 which was nice and spacious with a high ceiling. The room had a king bed with two twins on each side. The window had nice shutters that kept the early morning light out. The bathroom was spacious and had a full tub and shower, sink, bidet and toilet with a window. The room was well maintained and slept four adults comfortably. There was a small fridge but we did not use it. When you enter the building from the street you go up to floor 2 (that's the 3rd floor in the U.S.) where the check in and breakfast room are. Our room was on floor one. You are given both a room key and one for the exterior door and asked to keep it locked at night. The is an elevator which we just used to send up one person with our luggage because it is so small. The breakfast was a simple Italian breakfast on pastries, yogurt and fruit. The only problem we had was with dirty tile floors in the room. We mentioned it to the front desk and they apologized and said that there were teens in the rooms last week who spilled soda. They said it would get cleaned but that did not happen. We did not go sock or barefooted in the room because we would be covered in stickiness, lint and dirt. The location was excellent with the historic area at your doorstep. I enjoyed the sitting room we had on floor 2 that had a beautiful ceiling of frescoes and a large fridge with a freezer that appeared to be for public use. Internet in the room came and went but it was free. We drove right up to the hotel and someone took the car and parked it for us during the 2 nights we stayed in Florence. Parking is free, which is unusual for a city. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location for expoloring Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The owners are very friendly, recommending the places to eat and visit. The location is great with most of the amenities and sights within walking distance. We took the family room and it was huge. The only drawback was the lift (too small, can only fix in one luggage and 1 person) and the mosquitoes (maybe because the aircon was not really working - the room was not that cool).
reviews.title: Best hotel in terms of service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was perfect, very close to the main square (two blocks), yet far enough to be quiet at night; walking distance to just about everything of interest, including the train station. Excellent service, very friendly, family owned; the owners tended the desk frequently. The room was very clean and larger than expected; bathroom was modern, probably recently renovated; loved the really strong water pressure in the shower. Reasonably priced. Beds were fairly hard (you may like or dislike this); mattress was probably newish. Average breakfast. The only cons were very minor: the elevator was tiny (hard to get in with luggage, barely fit 3 people), and the shower stall in the bathroom was quite small as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, definitely highly recommended.
reviews.title: Loved the Europa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Europa was very nice. the staff was very helpful and kind. The room was larger than expected and newly refurbished.. It was everything that was promised and we ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. The location can't be beat, 2 blocks to the Duomo, 5 blocks to train station.
reviews.title: Clean, spacious, and close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel Europa is located very close to the station, a 5 minute walk. We did a trip to Florence for the day (1 hour) by train. It is about 15 minutes walk down to Piazza Maggiore, the central part of town. Our first impression of the hotel was not good. The man who was on reception when we checked in was really rude. He wanted to keep our passports and give them back to us later simply because he couldn't be bothered to photocopy them. We asked some basic questions which required information especially as it was Holy Week and we wanted to know about the religious services and he couldn't answer them. That evening when we came back a different man was on and he was extremely helpful and gave us alot of information (during our visit he was the only one). We stayed 4 days there and during that time we found the reception staff, women included less than pleasant and very unhelpful. This brings me to the other point on all three mornings, we were woken at 8.30am by the housekeeping staff. They seemed to take great delight in banging the doors of rooms loudly shut, banging their vaccum cleaner into walls and speaking at the top of their voices. The rooms have a red light on the outside which indicates it is occupied yet cleaning staff had absolutely no consideration for guests who may have been asleep.
