On a positive note, the breakfast was excellent value and included. You could eat as much as you liked with cereals, croissants and other pastries, eggs, bacon, ham, salami , fruit, yoghurt etc.. The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend the restaurant La Mela at 5 Via Fusari for dinner. Also the Basilica Di San Domenico is worth a visit, it has a beautiful cloister and St Domenic's tomb is there. I also enjoyed the market area off Piazza Maggiore. Also Eataly is a great place for food lovers to enjoy a glass of wine and some traditional food. Bologna is a beautiful city to explore with its covered walk ways and much more. If hotel service doesn't bother you then this is a good location to stay.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel & facilities but the majority of staff couldn't care less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night in this beautiful, spaciouse hotel on a layover. Found it through Tripadvisor reveiws, all of which were positive as I also found it to be so. The rooms are well appointed with excellent beds and lovely linens. The bathroom was elegant with a huge glassed in shower and heavy terry towels and bath robe(more 5star than the 4 this hotel has) However the BEST part was the breakfast, served in a large dining room and inclusive of everything one can immagin for breakfast. There were eggs in every form, bacon, cold cuts, cheeses,yoghurts, fresh brioches and scores of other pastries and breads,fresh and preserved fruits,juices(even freshly squeezed carrot juice) a gourmet choice of teas and af course excellent coffee and cappuccino--all this servedwith the cordiality tipical of the people of emilia-romagna!
reviews.title: lovely decor large airy feel and excellent breakfast
Excellent value but a bit of a hike from the centre
reviews.text: The Europa was good value - we were a small group and they gave us an excellent price. Our room was small but reasonably comfortable. However, soundproofing was poor - we could hear people walking about in the room overhead. Like other reviewers, the room temperature was problematic - very hot even though there was snow on the gorund otuside. Opening a window let in icy blasts! Breakfast was good.It was a long walk from the main square - could be a problem in the heat of summer.

reviews.title: Not recommended for business travellers
reviews.text: An aside: for eating out we thoroughly recommend Trattoria Tony in Via A Righi - it is so unpretentious that you would walk right past it. An Italian firiend introduced us to it - superb Bolognese food and utterly charming service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for business trip 3 days. Wifi was expensive €88 for the week or €21 per day.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Europa in late February and thought it was a great value. The room was large and very clean. Our room was also very quiet. The location of the hotel is excellent -- 5 minute walk form either the Accademia or the Duomo, 10 minutes from Uffizzi. The proprietors were very friendly, spoke English (a + for us) and helped us with museum and restaurant reservations. We drove into town, which was a bit of hassle -- make sure you print the directions to the hotel from their website -- and did not locate any parking near the hotel -- but, we parked along the road in front of the hotel briefly (heading towards the Duomo) and the hotel staff took the keys, called a parking service, and arranged overnight parking for 20 Euro, a very convenient service if you have a car.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Europa this past week. Great hospitality and had the benefit of an upgrade to a suite due to construction on the standard double room floor. In spite of several prior posts about towel and pillow quality, I was very happy with both. As noted, driving into Florence (first time visitors) and finding the hotel took a few loops around town before finding Via Cavour. Closeness to major sites is as advertised. In our book, Florence was more enjoyable than Rome. Good restaurant to try is Acqua al 2.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Florence

likes.disliked: — Internet connection speed was a tad above dial-up.

reviews.title: hotel europa
reviews.text: i promised myself i would write a short review of this very nice hotel close to the duomo and center of town. while the breakfast left someting to be desired we were able to book a large two bedroom suite that could accomodate our family. this was something of a rarity since we typically had to pay for two hotel rooms on most of our trip to italy and austria. the hotel staff was incredibly friendly, the price was reasonalble and the room we stayed in had a 300 year old fresco on the ceiling!!-- i would definitely recommend this hotel to families that are travelling in florence.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience!
reviews.text: mark pinnie

reviews.title: Perfect Place
reviews.text: Hotel Europa was by far the best hotel I stayed at during my study abroad experience in Europe. Eight-teen other students and myself felt right at home when staying at Hotel Europa. The owner, Gassim, and his family run the hotel and make you feel as if you are a part of the family as well. The hotel was clean and comfortable! I highly recommend it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked my parents a four night stay at the hotel for an anniversary/birthday treat - based on the postive reviews on your site. They asked me to write this review because all the great things said before are true. Robert and Miriam, the managers are incredibly friendly and helpful. Their room was spotless and spacious. The breakfast was fresh and mote than adequate. Location - spot on, central to most things. There were several nice restaurants and cafes close by as well. Very good value.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did a 2 week trip through italy doing rome flroence and positano and staying in 2 and 3 star hotels all the way.
reviews.title: Best hotel of our trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel Europa cost 108 euro for a double room b and b a night. For that you got a beautifully decorated, quiet hotel 7 minutes walk from the Duomo and 10 mins walk from the ponte vecchio. Our room was huge (for italy) with a king sized bed and a single bed, AC, tv, fridge and lovely bathroom with a window overlooking a courtyard.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are an Italian/english couple and are so friendly and helpful and have perfect english!! They rang both museums we wanted to visit and pre booked us tickets so we didn't have to q when we got there (q's to museums can be an hour and a half long). all free of charge.
reviews.title: Very helpful and friendly owners, great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009
reviews.text: Breakfast is continental with fresh coffee made any way you like it. There is parking provided by a car park company that comes to the hotel and picks up your car and like anywhere in italy it costs a bomb 24 euros a day.
reviews.title: Good value for money

description: The Hotel & Suites Europa located in the historical centre of Florence, is just a few steps away from the Cathedral of the Duomo, the railway station S.M. Novella and the Academy Gallery with the David of Michelangelo. Family managed, it has been recently renovated and offers its guests standard and suite rooms, most of them with a splendid view of Brunelleschi's Dome and Giotto's Bell Tower.
